citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
There was no written program of veterinary care available for review. The facility representative stated that they recently
changed attending veterinarians, but there is not a written program of veterinary care with the new attending veterinarian.
The animals appear healthy and had recently been seen by the attending veterinarian.
Failure to have written formal arrangements with an attending veterinarian that includes regularly scheduled visits to the
premises can result in inadequate veterinary care and negatively affect the welfare of the animals.
Each dealer must employ an attending veterinarian under formal arrangements which include a written program of
veterinary care and regularly scheduled visits to the facility.
Correct by: February 29, 2024

There was no written contingency plan on file at the facility.
Failure to have a written contingency plan can result in lack of readiness for emergencies or disasters.
Facilities must develop, document, and follow an appropriate plan to provide for the humane handling, treatment,
transportation, housing, and care of their animals in the event of an emergency or disaster.
Correct by: February 29, 2024
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
